definition: meeting place/place where people gather/CL:個|个[ge4]
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: He's just been setting up a bachelor party, he says.
sentences.chinese: 他說他剛纔在佈置一個單身漢派對的會場。

sentences.english: Each ace of kylin daredevil gathered in the interview venue.
sentences.chinese: 各家好手齊聚的麒麟藝高的面試會場。

sentences.english: Chinese boys watch a cartoon at a toy fair in Beijing on July 29 2010.
sentences.chinese: 北京的玩具展會場中，兩小男孩津津有味地在看卡通。

sentences.english: Traditionally, eight people carry in the flag at the Opening Ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 傳統上，在開幕典禮上會有八個人運送旗幟進入會場。

sentences.english: Now it is the main site of the yearly temple fair.
sentences.chinese: 磁器口每年一次的廟會也以此爲主會場。

sentences.english: This year, 450-plus attendees packed the tiny conference rooms.
sentences.chinese: 今年，超過450參會者裝滿了小的會場。

sentences.english: Free shuttle bus service between Trade Fair Center and hotel is available.
sentences.chinese: 交易會期間免費提供穿梭巴士往返交易會會場。

sentences.english: The spy wormed in the meeting-place.
The Main Assembly Room lies in the South Building, with capacity of 2051 persons.
sentences.chinese: 主會場位於南樓，總計觀衆座席2051個。

sentences.english: Hearty chuckles from the early morning crowd just settling into their seats.
sentences.chinese: 一早進入會場落座的人羣裏傳來會心的笑聲。

sentences.english: A: The audience will be composed largely of senior managers and management consultants of meeting and exhibition venues.
sentences.chinese: 聽衆主要是會場和展覽館的高級經理或管理顧問。

sentences.english: I've found a way to sneak out of the meting .
sentences.chinese: 我找到了悄悄離開會場的方法。

sentences.english: The delegates entered the assembly hall by way of the lobby.
sentences.chinese: 代表們通過大廳進入會場。

sentences.english: There were lots of amusements at the fair.
sentences.chinese: 展覽會場有很多有趣的東西。

sentences.english: Even as a journalist, you may not be able to just walk into some conferences.
sentences.chinese: 即便是記者，你也未必能夠直接走進一些會議的會場。

sentences.english: I didn't know for sure until I snuck into his office.
sentences.chinese: 我不想讓他知道我回來，悄悄溜進了會場。

definition: the scene (of a crime, accident etc)/(on) the spot/(at) the site
to enter the venue/to enter the arena/(aviation) to approach the airfield/(investing) to get into the market
to be present/to be on the scene
to exercise/to move about/to operate/to use connections (personal influence)/loose/shaky/active/movable/activity/campaign/maneuver/behavior/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
to compete/to take part in a competition
